abstract: Microsoft challenged the rules on competition and antitrust law. Now, it’s Google’s turn.
snippet: Microsoft challenged the rules on competition and antitrust law. Now, it’s Google’s turn.
lead_paragraph: Bill Gates, who walked away from full-time work at Microsoft last month, was perhaps the foremost applied economist of the second half of the 20th century.

headline.main: Google, Zen Master of the Market
headline.print_headline: Google, Zen Master Of The Market

abstract: The court order forcing Google to turn over records of who has viewed and uploaded videos on YouTube shows how much information about people’s Internet use can be disclosed in a legal proceeding. It may be time for Internet companies and Congress to look more closely at setting specific rules governing those records.
snippet: The court order forcing Google to turn over records of who has viewed and uploaded videos on YouTube shows how much information about people’s Internet use can be disclosed in a legal proceeding. It may be time for Internet companies and Congress ...
lead_paragraph: Whenever questions are raised about privacy, big online companies talk about how benign their plans are for using data about their customers: Much data is anonymous, they say, and even the information that is linked to individuals is only meant to offer users a more personal experience tailored to their interests.

headline.main: One Subpoena Is All It Takes to Reveal Your Online Life
